arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings as Anderson and Willumsson cap Lincoln comeback
arts.sum: The closest Blues came to a second goal before half-time came via a wonderful effort from Alfie May. May played a clever one-two with Anderson before unleashing a shot from 25 yards that hit the outside of the post. Tomoki Iwata’s cut-back from the right was intelligently dummied by Willumsson for Anderson to stroke home his second goal of the afternoon.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies thrilled by 'growth' with just one gripe after Birmingham City's latest comeback
arts.sum: Willum Willumsson put Blues ahead just after half-time before Anderson made the game safe late on. For the second league game running Blues conceded via a long throw-in.

arts.ttl: Leaders Birmingham come from behind to win at Lincoln
Chris Davies press conference: Training ramped up, squad review and Birmingham City’s opposite
arts.sum: “After the Shrewsbury game we had a little bit of training, then we had a few days off and we’ve come back in this week and we’ve been working hard,” Davies explained at his pre-Lincoln City press conference on Friday morning. Chris Davies has put his squad to work this week after allowing them some time away from Birmingham City’s bustling training ground during the international break.

arts.ttl: Stansfield out: Birmingham City team news and predicted XI to face Lincoln City
arts.sum: The latest Birmingham City team news as Chris Davies' side gear up to face Lincoln City in the League One. The post Stansfield out: Birmingham City team news and predicted XI to face Lincoln City appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Jay Stansfield injured on international duty in blow to Birmingham City
arts.sum: Jay Stansfield is set to miss Birmingham City’s trip to Lincoln after picking up an injury on international duty with England under-21s. After Blues play fifth-placed Lincoln at Sincil Bank on Saturday, they host Bolton Wanderers before making the short trip to third-placed Mansfield Town next weekend.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City dealt big blow ahead of Lincoln City test amid update on £15m star
arts.sum: Birmingham City boss Chris Davies has said Jay Stansfield is expected to miss this weekend’s game against Lincoln… The post Birmingham City dealt big blow ahead of Lincoln City test amid update on £15m star appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Five changes and Alfie May out - Predicted Birmingham City line-up for Lincoln - Alex Dicken - Birmingham Live
arts.sum: (4-2-3-1): Allsop; Gardner-Hickman, Klarer, Davies, Cochrane; Iwata, Paik; Wright, Willumsson, Hansson; Stansfield Provided Tomoki Iwata has recovered from the ankle knock he sustained at Shrewsbury and Paik Seung-ho isn’t jet-lagged from his international exertions with South Korea, Davies is expected to go with his first choice midfield pairing against Lincoln.

arts.ttl: Tomoki Iwata injury latest with seven Birmingham City players at risk of missing Lincoln
arts.sum: Chris Davies has had to contend with injuries in recent weeks and Jay Stansfield has joined those in the treatment room after returning from international duty with a knock. Blues skipper Krystian Bielik and Lee Buchanan are out, Ethan Laird is training and Luke Harris is in light training.

arts.ttl: Tom Wagner must keep his promise when Birmingham City realise Knighthead's dream
arts.sum: Now that ‘twenty is plenty’ is a thing of the past, that is about the going rate in League One. Lincoln City have charged Blues fans £25 for a ticket to this weekend’s game. Having asked adults to shell out up to £40 for a seat inside St Andrew’s @ Knighthead Park last season, Blues have lowered prices following relegation.
